name: Sausage With Chard and Rhubarb
description: This quick sausage dish is perfect for spring. The dark green chard adds freshness, while the rhubarb lends a citrus-like sour note that cuts through the richness of the sausages. If you don’t have any mustard seeds on hand, leave them out. While they do add a pleasant heat and gentle crunch, you won’t miss them if you didn’t know they were supposed to be there. Use any kind of sausage you like here: pork, duck, lamb or turkey all work well with the rhubarb and greens.
recipeCategory: dinner, for two, lunch, quick, weekday
keywords: main course, rhubarb, sausage, swiss chard
recipeIngredient: 1 pound hot Italian sausage (pork or turkey)
1 pound red or white Swiss chard, center ribs removed and leaves chopped
Fine sea salt and freshly ground pepper, as needed

recipeInstructions.text: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, warm oil. Prick sausages with a fork and place in skillet. Cook, turning occasionally, until browned all over and cooked through, about 10 minutes. Transfer sausages to a plate.

Add shallots to oil and reduce heat to medium. Cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in mustard seeds and garlic; cook 1 minute. Add rhubarb and greens, a handful at a time, and a large pinch of salt. Cook until the greens wilt and become tender, about 10 minutes. Season with more salt and pepper. Serve sausages on top of greens.
